Este negocio le ha permitido a  Victoria apoyar a sus hijos con su educación, pues ha tenido que luchar para sacar sola adelante  a sus hijos. Su mayor deseo es de poner un puesto fijo donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito pues comprará galletas, chicles, chocolates y bebidas.  El grupo “Mujeres Triunfadoras” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito, pues le  permite su progreso. Victoria se encuentra en la parte posterior es la segunda del lado izquierdo,  viste chompa rosada y pantalón azul.
texts.en:
Victoria’s a member of the “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Victorious Women) group consisting of nine active, responsible people who are currently going through their 5th cycle.  

Victoria, 55, is separated with three children.  Victoria has worked for the last 20 years selling snacks from place to place in a park near her location.  This business has made it possible for Victoria to support her children’s education for she’s had to strive alone to move her children forward.  Her greatest wish is to set up a fixed stand in which to sell her goods.

In order to continue improving, she’s requested the loan to buy cookies, gum, chocolates and soft-drinks.  Victoria appears in the rear, second from the left, wearing a pink sweater and blue pants.

The “Mujeres Triunfadoras” group are grateful to the people who make this loan possible because it makes their progress possible.

loans.use: to buy cookies, gum, chocolates and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods for her business.

loans.name: Peter Morlai's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. 

This group of teachers has come to SMT to request a group loan of SLL 5,000,000 in order to meet their most urgent and most pressing financial challenges. At the end of each month, they can repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for doing the deductions and making the repayments on their behalf.

Peter is the featured leader of this team. He is a native of Royoma Bana village, in northern Sierra Leone. Peter is age 56, he is married to a trader, and the couple have four children, all of whom are attending schools. Peter has been a school teacher for 33 years now. 

He has requested this loan in order to pay school/college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school/college fees for his children.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel  es un hombre agricultor de 50  años de edad.  El es soltero, vive junto a sus 8 hijos los cuales son 4 hombres  y 4 mujeres en el Caserío Cipresales, Aldea Xajaxac Sololá, Sololá.
El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando zanahoria y lo realiza a unos metros de su vivienda. Esto lo aprendió de su padre desde que era pequeño, es así como poco a poco fue obteniendo ingresos y ganancias aceptables que lo han ayudado a salir adelante junto a su familia.
El empezó a trabajar su propio cultivo desde hace 30 años, eligió esta actividad porque es productiva y le genera buenas ganancias. Es por ello que ahora está solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para comprar semillas de zanahoria y abono orgánico para poder y cultivarlo y comercializarlo. 
Su mayor sueño es ampliar su cultivo para generar más ganancias y así poder remodelar su vivienda para que su familia viva en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Miguel, 50, works in agriculture.  He’s single living with his 8 children, four boys and four girls, in Caserío Cipresales, Xajaxac Village, Sololá, Sololá.

He works in agriculture growing carrots a few meters from his house.  He learned this from his father when still very little and this is how he’s gradually earned income and acceptable profits that have helped him to get ahead with his family.

He started working on his own crops 30 years ago.  He chose this activity because it’s productive and generates good profits.  Because of this he’s asking for a 5,000 Quetzal loan to buy carrot seeds and organic manure to be able to grow them and sell them.  His greatest dream is to expand his crops in order to generate higher profits to be able to remodel his house so that his family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds and organic manure.

loans.name: Benkadi  I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe  BENKADI I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelle à MISSANSO, l’un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre l’arachide, le mais et le piment.
Avec  ADISSA 2ème personne à gauche de la photo position assise. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des engrais  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à Lobougoula après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 85.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "BENKADI I" are married women, who average 45 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in MISSANSO, a village in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali (Sikasso). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their sixth farm loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown include peanuts, corn, and chili peppers, as is the case with ADISSA, who is sitting second from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in the village and in Lobougoula.

She plans on making a profit of 85,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Tiormoula  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe TIORMOULA  III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelle à IFOLA, l’un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre l’arachide, le mais et le pois sucré.
Avec  OUMOU 2ème personne à gauche de la photo, avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des engrais  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à Farakala après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 50.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the group "TIORMOULA III" are married women, who average 45 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in IFOLA, a village in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali (Sikasso). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their seventh farm loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown include peanuts, corn, and sweet peas, as is the case with OUMOU, who is second from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in the village and in Farakala.

She plans on making a profit of 50,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Tiormoula  Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe TIORMOULA IV sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelle à IFOLA, l’un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre: l’arachide, le mais et le pois sucré.
Avec  ALATOU 3ème personne à gauche de la photo, avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des engrais  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à Farakala après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 85.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the group "TIORMOULA IV" are married women, who average 45 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in IFOLA, a village in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali (Sikasso). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their seventh farm loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown include peanuts, corn, and sweet peas, as is the case with ALATOU, who is third from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in the village and in Farakala.

She plans on making a profit of 85,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 65 years old and married with five children.

Josefina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy shampoo, can goods, egg, noodles, spices, and other items to sell. 


Josefina has borrowed and paid off 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years, and she earns additional income from selling rice.

Josefina aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, can goods, egg, noodles, spices, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Ana Marie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from her general store. Ana Marie is borrowing 13000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Ana Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing materials.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Riza works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Riza is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, rice, coconut milk, etc. for her food vending business.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Riza has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, rice, coconut milk, etc.

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en: Arcelie is 38 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Arcelie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc. She has been in this business for 12 years. In the future Arcelie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, canned goods, spices, etc. for her general store business. She has been in this business for 12 years. She earns more income from raising pigs and selling rice.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, canned goods, spices, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 58 years old, widowed, and has six children. She has an agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm equipment.

Erlinda has been farming rice for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm equipment

loans.name: Glowina

texts.en:
Glowina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a gravestone-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials, like paints, paint brushes, cement, and marble for her business.

Glowina has been in this business for eight years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Glowina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, like paints, paint brushes, cement, and marble for her business.

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelle à MISSANSO, l’un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre l’arachide, le mais et le piment. 
Avec  GNIRE 1ère personne à droite de la photo position débout. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des engrais  pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 85.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi II group are married women with an average age of 40 years and four children, all living in traditional families in Missanso, one of the villages in Sikasso, the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They work with Kiva field partner Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is the group's sixth agricultural loan with this institution, and all past loans have been repaid. The group uses the funds to grow peanuts, corn and peppers. 

Ms. Gnire is standing up on the far right of the photo. With this ​​loan, she intends to buy fertilizer to maintain one hectare of farmland. After the harvest, her crops will be sold in the village and at the market to male and female customers. Gnire expects to make a profit of 85,000 FCFA per season, which will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose is a 30-year-old father who lives with his partner and young son in the district of Parcona within the Ica region. Jose is a full-time construction worker who enjoys playing soccer in his free time and always loves to eat a plate of "carapulcra" (Andean stew and noodles). His current job requires that he purchase his own tools to be successful, which is why he is taking out this loan. Jose is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their generosity, as their help motivates him to continue forward to reach his lifelong dream of starting his own business.

loans.use: to purchase his own construction tools

loans.name: Carlos Diego Alonso

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 21 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Carlos no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Carlos trabaja como operario en el área de costura de una empresa textil de su ciudad,el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y dedicación.
Carlos se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará una habitación en su vivienda, ya que desea reforzarla, así pues Carlos seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Carlos, 21, is single and lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings.  He's a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person with a big desire for self-improvement.  Unfortunately Carlos hasn't been able to study business administration as he would like to because he lacks the economic resources and needs to work.

On his own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Carlos works in the field of sewing in a textile company in his city.  He works every day for approximately 10 hours.  He believes it's going well for him because of his performance and dedication.

Carlos is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll improve and reinforce a room in his house.  He'll continue working and making an effort to achieve his big dream of having his own house.

loans.use: to improve his house

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Daisy works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing and fish vending. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like spices, soap, noodles, eggs, milk, etc. for her general store business.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like spices, soap, noodles, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, three of whom are in school, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Erlinda is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

She has been in this business for 5 years. Carina earns more income from motorcycle transport and fish vending businesses. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Barrio Sucre  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Barrio Sucre está formado por 14 mujeres quienes trabajan a diario para mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus hogares y brindarles un mejor futuro a sus familias, son mujeres que a pesar de todas las adversidades buscan la manera de salir  adelante y brindarles a sus hijos un mejor porvenir, trabajan en la crianza de animales, en la agricultura y el comercio, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
Viven por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar que por su situación geográfica goza de bellos paisajes, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo tradicional y lo moderno.


Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa, es socia activa del grupo de crédito Barrio Sucre desde hace 3 años tiempo en el que ha establecido una muy buena amistad con todas sus compañeras y vecinas, han compartido buenos y malos momentos.

La Señora. Rosa tiene 57 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijos ya son casados, sus cuatro hijos solteros trabajan y ayudan económicamente. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es el fruto del trabajo conyugal.

Doña Rosa labora desde muy joven en las duras tareas del campo, la cual aprendió de sus padres y ahora es su fuente de ingresos, siembra de hortalizas las que vende en su comunidad, hace algunos años se dedica al negocio de animales, compra y vende pollos, cuyes y chachos en las ferias de la ciudad. 

Su nuevo crédito va a  invertir en la compra de cuyes, pollos y chanchos para continuar en esta actividad. 

Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Barrio Sucre village bank is made up of 14 women who work every day to improve the economic stability of their households and offer their families a better life. These women, despite all adversities, seek a way to move forward life and provide their children a better future. They work raising animals, growing crops, and as merchants, although they maintain their villages' culture and traditions.

They live in the village of Cumbe, in Cuenca, a place with beautiful landscapes and an architecture that is a mix of traditional and modern.

One of the group's members is Rosa, who has been an active member of Barrio Sucre for three years and established close friendships with the other group members and her neighbors, sharing good times and bad with them.

Rosa is 57 years old, and she and her partner have six adult children. Two of their children are already married, while the other four work and help their parents economically. Her partner works in construction as a mason, and they built the house they live in together.

Rosa has been doing the difficult labors of farmwork since she was very young. She learned the work from her parents and now makes her living that way. She grows produce that she sells in her community, and for several years she has also been selling animals, buying chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs and selling them in the local market.

She will use this new loan to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs for her business.

Her goal is to keep expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children who are in school, Zenaida works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Zenaida is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, chips, soft drinks, milk, soap, etc. for her general store business.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, chips, soft drinks, milk, soap, etc.

loans.name: Glory Stella

texts.en:
Glory Stella is 43 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. Glory Stella is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in the pig fattening business for 13 years now, and has borrowed 29 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Glory Stella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs, spices, etc. for her business. Joan has been in this business for 6 years. She earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Joan dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, shampoo, noodles, eggs, spices, etc.

loans.name: Julivie

texts.en:
Julivie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets, wood, paints, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

She has been in this business for 4 years now. In the future, Julivie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, wood, paints, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Demerose

texts.en:
Demerose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct selling business (Avon products) in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of Avon to sell. She has been in this business for 7 years, and earns more income from buying and selling rice and farming sugarcane.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her businesses. Demerose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of Avon to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles, and chips.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan es originario de la ciudad de Granada, tiene 34 años de edad, padre de tres hijos. Se dedica hace 10 años al servicio de transporte turístico a través de lancha. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda, ya que podrá solucionar el problema que tiene con uno de sus servicios de transporte. Solicita el crédito para comprar: un motor que le hace falta a una de sus lanchas, ya que piensa incluirla en su servicio con el fin de adquirir mayores clientes que deseen realizar un paseo por el lago. Tiene como plan futuro comprar varias lanchas logrando ofrecer mejor servicio a los  turistas. Su meta próxima es legalizar  el permiso de una de sus lanchas.
texts.en: Juan is from the city of Granada.  He’s 34-years-old and father of three children.  For the last ten years he’s been working providing boat rides for tourists.  He figures that the loan will be of great help because he’ll be able to solve a problem he has with one of his boats.  He’s asking for the loan to buy a motor for one of his boats that needs one because he’s thinking of putting it into service so that he can acquire more customers who would like to take trips on the lake.  His future plan is to buy several boats to offer better service to the tourists.  His next goal is to get  legal permits for one of his boats.

loans.use: to buy a motor.

loans.name: Nueva Ilusión  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Nueva Ilusión está formado por 8 mujeres y 1 hombre quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar que goza de mucha vegetación y de bellos paisajes que le regala su geografía accidentada, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo antiguo. Su gente al igual que las socias mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, al igual que su gastronomía, su principal fuente de  ingreso es la agricultura,  la crianza de animales en especial la ganadería, muchos laboran en la ciudad ejerciendo diferentes cargos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Francisca, es una socia amable y gentil, le gusta los créditos en grupo porque es una forma de estrechar los lasos de amistad y solidaridad entre todas las socias.

La Señora Francisca tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera de 5 hijos, dos de ellos son casados y viven independientes, uno de sus hijos trabaja y ayuda económicamente, uno de sus hijos estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo está estudiando en la escuela. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Francisca es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se dedica a las tareas del campo como es la cría de cuyes y pollos, también cultiva sus tierras y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su casa, por ocasiones también trabaja labrando tierras ajenas. Se dedica a la limpieza de casas y cuando le llaman también se dedica a lavar ropa. 

Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos y alimento para sus animales. 

Su sueño es comprarse un terreno para hacer su casa.

Las dos fotos pequeñas son de un socio y una socia que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Ilusión” (New Hope) credit group consists of 8 women and one man living around Cuenca’s Cumbe Parish, a place with lush vegetation and beautiful scenery caused by its fractured geography and its architecture blending the modern with the old.  Its inhabitants as well as the group members still retain the culture and traditions of its peoples as well as their gastronomy.  The main sources of income are agriculture and raising livestock, especially cattle, and many of them work in various jobs in the city.

One of the group members is Francisca, a nice, kind member.  She likes the group loans because it’s a way of strengthening the bonds of friendship and solidarity among all the members.

Francisca is 50-years-old and single mother of five children.  Two of them are married living independently and one of her sons works and helps her out economically.  Another son attends university and her youngest attends school.  She does not own a house; she’s a renter.

Francisca’s a very hardworking woman who works doing field chores like raising guinea pigs and chickens; she also cultivates her land and what she grows is for home consumption.  Occasionally she works the land of others.  She also works cleaning houses and when she’s asked to she also takes in  laundry.  She will use the new loan to buy chicks and feed for her animals.  Her dream is to buy land to build her house on.

The two small photos are of members who were unable to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy chicks and animal feed.

loans.name: Andrea Patricia

texts.es:
Andrea es una señorita que decidió estudiar estética y cosmetología ya que siempre le gusto todo lo relacionado con el área de la estética en procedimientos faciales y corporales para embellecer a las personas que así lo deseen no solo por vanidad sino también por salud, su gran deseo es poder culminar sus estudios y lograr tener su propio centro de estética para así lograr ser una mujer totalmente independiente y pode sacar a su familia adelante y lograr muchas cosas más como poder tener su propia vivienda y seguir actualizándose en lo relacionado con su carrera realizando seminarios, especializaciones, diplomados, etc. con el fin de lograr tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella agradece las oportunidades brindadas pues lo que más anhela es realizar sus sueños a corto mediano y largo plazo nunca antes tuvo la posibilidad de estudiar y ahora que encontró las herramientas para llegar a sus sueños no desperdiciara un solo segundo pues su mayor dicha es desempañarse en lo que le gusta demostrar sus capacidades a diario compartir con las personas e incentivarlas a seguir por donde los guía su corazón aunque las dudas se presentes y los obstáculos aumenten conseguir lo que se desea no es tarea fácil pero tampoco imposible, solo desea las herramientas para labrar su camino porque ya tiene todo el interés las ganas y el amor por ir tras sus sueños.
Andrea tiene una hermosa familia que son su motor, ella quiere ser motivo de orgullo y admiración es el eje de su hogar y no ha parado de luchar por demostrar a los demás y así misma que por más adversidades y dificultades siempre se puede soñar porque para los sueños no hay límite ni punto de llegada pues se impulsan con la fuerza del corazón y los alimenta las esperanzas del alma así cree Andrea que por más difícil parezca encontrar la meta de llegada más grande será aun la recompensa por tanto esfuerzo
texts.en:
Andrea is a young woman who decided to pursue beauty and cosmetic studies as she has always liked everything to do with beauty in terms of body and facial treatments to make people beautiful who want to not only for aesthetic reasons but also health ones. Her biggest dream is to be able to complete her studies and succeed in having her own beauty salon to become a fully independent woman, get her family ahead in life and achieve many more things such as having her own home and continuing to keep up-to-date with her field carrying out seminars, specializations, diplomas and so on, with the aim of having a better quality of life.

Andrea is thankful for the opportunities given as what she aspires to is to make her dreams come true in the short, medium and long term. She has never had the opportunity to study beforehand and now that she has found the tools to achieve her dreams, she will not let them out of her sight for even one second. This is because her greatest joy is performing what she enjoys and demonstrating her abilities on a daily basis, sharing with people and encouraging them to follow their heart even though there are doubts and obstacles mount up. Getting what you want is not an easy task, but nor is it impossible, Andrea only wants the tools to pave her way as she already has all the drive, interest and desire to chase her dreams.

Andrea has a beautiful family which is her driving force; she wants to be a source of pride and admiration to them: she is the linchpin of the household and she has not stopped fighting to show the others even through the greatest of setbacks and difficulties. She can always dream because dreams do not have a limit nor have a point of arrival, as they are driven by the strength of the heart and feed the soul's hopes, as such Andrea believes that the more difficult it seems to reach the end goal, the greater the reward for so much effort.

loans.use: to study Cosmetics in Campoalto.

loans.name: Luz Eneida

texts.es: Luz Eneida tiene dos hijas por las cuales siempre ha trabajado y sueña con sacarlas adelante, otro de sus sueños siempre ha sido estudiar en una academia, toda la vida ha soñado con estudiar estética facial y corporal porque es algo  muy bonito para  poder tener un contacto con las demás personas, poderlas ayudar de alguna u otra forma, el deseo de ella es trabajar  con su hermana Mary Luz  ya que  es esteticista y su hermana Angélica que es manicurista asi mismo poder montar un salón muy grande donde tenga belleza integral y estética o si es posible un spa con ayuda de Dios quiere hacer realidad  todos sus sueños , y para ello necesita  estudiar y trabajar muy duro porque la meta de ella es sacar a sus hijas adelante que sean unas profesionales ya que cuando ella era joven nunca pudo ir a una universidad ni poder estudiar nada solo su bachillerato, después cuando ya este  montado su salón y tenga todas las cosas marchando bien  ella piensa en conseguir trabajadores para tener más locales y administrarlos asegurándose de que sus negocios tengan el mejor servicio al cliente, teniendo a su clientela contenta y satisfecha con la atención brindada, porque en eso está el secreto para todo, en la calidad de lo que se hace, porque siempre se deben hacer las cosas con amor y dedicación, Luz Eneida es una mujer que siempre se ha querido ver bien, ella tiene el firme propósito que estudiando Estética  se sentirá bien ayudando a los demás para que se vean bien y brindando oportunidades de trabajo, siendo su motivación sus papas y hermanos por quienes responde teniendo como meta regalarles su casa para que descansen y disfruten su vejez. Por ahora seguirá soñando y tratando de hacer todo realidad con el mayor esfuerzo y berraquera que la caracterizan a ella y como una mujer valiente.
texts.en:
Luz Eneida has two daughters. She has always worked for them and dreams of getting them ahead. Another of her dreams has always been to study at an academy. Her whole life she has wanted to go to beauty school and learn facial and body treatments, beacuse it is a beautiful thing to have contact with other people and help them in one way or another. She wants to work with her sister Mary Luz, who is a beautician, and her sister Angélica, who is a manicurist, and set up a very large salon providing comprehensive beauty and styling services, or if possible a spa. With God's help, she wants to make all of her dreams come true, and in order to do so she needs to study and work very hard, because her goal is to provide for her daughters and for them to have careers, since when she was young she only went to high school and was never able to attend university or get a higher education. Later on, when her salon is up and running and everything is going well, she plans to hire workers so that they can open more businesses and manage them, making sure that they offer the best customer service. She wants to keep her customers happy and satisfied with the help they receive, because that is the secret to everything: the quality of what you do, beacuse you must always do things with love and dedication. 

Luz Eneida is a woman who has always cared about looking good. Her set purpose is that by becomeing a beautician she will feel good about helping others look good and about offering employment opportunities. Her parents and siblings are her motivation, and her goal is to buy them a house so that they can rest and enjoy their retirement. For now she will continue to dream and to try to make everything a reality with all of her effort and the drive she is known for and that has made her a brave woman.

loans.use: to go to beauty school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his car.

loans.name: Nelly  Esmeralda

texts.es:
UN GRAN SUEÑO DE AMOR Y SERVICIO.
Erase una vez una Joven Que Se Llamaba Luisa termino su Bachillerato en Bogotá al finalizar el estudio del Colegio Luisa tenía el anhelo de estudiar algo de medicina, ya que cuando estaba en el colegio perteneció a un grupo de la cruz roja y ayudaba en las labores de enfermería de la institución atendiendo a los niños cuando la necesitaban y se salía del salón para ayudar; Es así como en el corazón de Luisa se albergaba un gran deseo de servicio a los demás a través de la enfermería y soñaba con poder trabajar en servicio de los ancianos, niños especiales siendo enfermera.
Por esto le gustaría ser como un angelito blanco como es su vestido de enfermera que representa el amor y el servicio por el otro.
Luisa se ha esforzado por sacar a sus dos pequeños hijos a delante a pesar de las adversas circunstancias económicas y de las duras pruebas que ha tenido que atravesar siendo madre cabeza de familia.  A Luisa le gustaría terminar su programa en auxiliar de enfermería por que ve la posibilidad de cumplir sus sueños y así ayudar a muchos y servir a la comunidad.
En la actualidad Luisa no ha dejado de lado su sueño de ser enfermera y por eso en este momento está haciendo todo lo posible gracias a DIOS por trabajar duro y ahorrar para poder asistir a una escuela de enfermería, Luisa en la actualidad desea ser ayudada económicamente ya que el pago por su trabajo no es el suficiente para pagar las cuotas de la escuela y mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
A BIG DREAM OF LOVE AND SERVICE.
Once upon a time there was a young woman named Luisa who finished high school in Bogotá. She longed to study medicine, because in high school she  had belonged to a Red Cross group and volunteered in the infirmary at school, taking care of the children when they needed her. Luisa's heart therefore harbored a marvelous dream to serve others through nursing, and she dreamed of being able to work to help the elderly and children as a nurse.
She would like to be an angel in white, and her nurse's uniform represents love and service to others.
Luisa has made a great effort to offer her two little children a better life despite her difficult economic circumstances and the tough challenges she has had to face as a single mother. Luisa would like to finish her nursing program, which she believes offers her a chance to fulfill her dreams, helping many and serving the community.
Luisa has not set aside her dream of becoming a nurse, so she is currently doing everything possible thanks to GOD to work hard and save enough to be able to go to nursing school. Luisa hopes to receive economic assistance, as her salary is not enough to pay the school fees and support her two little children.

loans.use: to pay for her third semester studying nursing.

loans.name: Fabiola Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora Fabiola se encuentra en el grupo de crédito La Paz desde hace 4 años, tiempo en el que establecido muy buena amistad con todas las socias y amigas de este grupo, vive en el cantón de Girón, lugar que tiene varios lugares turísticos como cascadas y paisajes para disfrutar de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica al comercio, crianza de animales y agricultura. Aun mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora Fabiola tiene 36 años de edad, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido dos hijos de 20 y 15 años, pero está muy contenta ya que se encuentra embarazada y esta su octavo mes de gestación, su primer hijo es casado y vive en su casa compartiendo los gastos del hogar, su segunda hija estudia en el colegio. Su esposo es de profesión sastre, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Fabiola tiene su propio negocio el cual es un pequeño local de venta de comida, lleva un año en esta actividad que poco a poco va teniendo más comensales. En su tiempo libre se dedica a la venta de billetes de lotería.

Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de mesas, sillas y una vajilla para su negocio. 

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Fabiola joined the credit group La Paz four years ago, a period of time in which she formed strong friendships with all the members and friends of this group. She lives in the district of Girón, an area that has various tourist spots such as waterfalls and countryside for the enjoyment of nature. Its people work in business, animal husbandry, and agriculture. They still maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

Señora Fabiola is 36 years old, lives in a common-law marriage, and out of this marriage has two children, 20 and 15 years old. She is very happy to find herself pregnant, and is in her eighth month. Her first child is married and lives at home, sharing the household expenses; her second child is in school. Her spouse works as a tailor. They don’t own their own home, so they rent.

Señora Fabiola has her own business, which is a small food stand. For one year she has worked at the food stand, and little by little she has more diners. In her free time she works selling lottery tickets.

Her new loan is to invest in the purchase of tables, chairs, and tableware for her business. 

Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and tableware.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina is 59 years old and lives in Tag-ibo, San Juan, Siquijor. She is married with five children who are adults.
Segundina sells fish for a living earning approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan amounting to PHP 9,000.00 to be used in purchasing additional fishing materials.
Segundina is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Segundina hopes to expand her business with this institution.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing materials

loans.name: Merinciana

texts.en: Merinciana is married with two school-age children. Merinciana is 55 years old and lives in Lilo-an, Maria, Siquijor. Merinciana engaged in food vending to earn a living and had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 3,000.00 to be used in purchasing additional vegetables and fruits such as potatoes and carrots. Merinciana is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Merinciana hopes to expand and improve her business with this institution.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Kirk

texts.en:
Kirk is married, with two children. He is 40 years old and lives in San Nicolas, Tudela, Philippines.

Kirk is a farmer and he grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for ten years. 

He has requested a loan to purchase additional housing materials.

Kirk has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for five years. In the future, Kirk hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional housing materials.

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa desde hace algún tiempo forma parte del grupo de crédito La Paz. Vive por la comunidad de Paccha en Cuenca, lugar que tiene mucha vegetación, su geografía es accidentada la cual le regala hermosos paisajes, tiene un clima frió, pero su gente tienen un corazón cálido, se dedican al trabajo del campo como la crianza de animales, la agricultura y el comercio.

La Señora Rosa tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero trabaja y ayuda económicamente.  La casa en la que vive es propia.

Doña Rosa desde hace 20 años se dedica al comercio, vende una gran variedad de productos como lasos para el cabello, vinchas, ropa interior y más, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. En su casa se dedica  a la crianza de pollos y cerdos, todas estas actividades le han permitido superarse poco a poco.
 
Su nuevo crédito va a invertir en la compra de ropa interior, lasos y vinchas para el cabello.

Su meta es continuar creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa’s been part of the “La Paz” credit group for some time now.  She lives in Cuenca’s Paccha community, a place with lush vegetation and fractured geography that creates beautiful scenery.  It’s cold climate but its residents are warm-hearted.  They work in the fields raising animals, in agriculture and in commerce.

Rosa is 50-years-old and single mother of three adult children.  Two of them are married living independently and her single son works and helps her out economically.  The house she lives in is her own.

For the last 20 years Rosa has been working in commerce.  She sells a wide variety of products like hair bands, hair clips, underwear and others.  She works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.  She also raises chickens and pigs at home.  All of these activities have made it possible for her to gradually improve.

She will use her new loan to buy underwear, hair clips and hair bands.  Her goal is to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy underwear, hair clips and hair bands.

loans.name: Tiormoula  I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe TIORMOULA  I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelle à IFOLA, l’un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre: l’arachide, le mais et le pois sucré.
Avec  ABY 1ère personne à droite de la photo position débout, avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des engrais  pour entretenir 0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à Farakala après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 100.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "TIORMOULA I" are married women, who average 45 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in IFOLA, a village in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali (Sikasso). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their seventh farm loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown include peanuts, corn, and sweet peas, as is the case with ABY, who is standing first from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in the village and in Farakala.

She plans on making a profit of 100,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer

loans.name: Tiormoula Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe TIORMOULA II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelle à IFOLA, l’un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre: l’arachide, le maïs et le pois sucré.
Avec  AWA 1ère personne à droite de la photo position débout, avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des engrais  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à Farakala après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 90.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "TIORMOULA II" are married women, who average 45 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in IFOLA, a village in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali (Sikasso). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their seventh farm loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown include peanuts, corn, and sweet peas, as is the case with AWA, who is standing first from the right in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in the village and in Farakala.

She plans on making a profit of 90,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer

loans.name: Maa Tarini Group

texts.en:
This group is called “Maa Tarini”. It was formed in the year 2013. All the six members of this group are women from the village of Kalsaipali and belong to the Below Poverty Line category. Kalsaipali is a rural village in the district of Bolangir of Odisha, one of the poorest districts in India. the majority of the inhabitants of this village depend upon cultivation and in almost all families there is a milk business. 

Urmila is one of the members of Maa Tarini group. She is standing third from right, raising her hand in the photo. She is 51 years old and is a straight-forward lady, living with her husband, two sons aged 24 and 18 and one daughter aged 20. The primary work of Urmila is milk selling .Now she has five cows producing 20 liters of milk per day. Urmila supplies this milk to the households of Balangir town at 20 INR per liter. With this price of milk, on a monthly basis, from this business she gets an income of 5000 INR. Apart from this, her son and husband run a vegetable cultivation and vending business to add some extra income to the family. As there is growing demand for milk in the community, Urmila has planned to utilize the present loan for purchasing another cow of the Jersey variety. Urmila has a dream to save some money for construction of a house and purchasing a bike.

The other five members Santilata, Janaki, Lakshmi, Budh and Mukhi are also doing the same business of milk selling.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a cow.

loans.name: Nennet

texts.en:
Nennet is 28 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.  Nennet works very hard to provide for them.

Nennet runs a business buying and selling Nescafe products in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of Nescafe products to sell.  Nennet has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future, Nennet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of Nescafe products to sell

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines. Nita is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell for her business buying and selling rice grains.

Nita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 29 years old and married with six children, five of whom are in school.

Elisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, soft drinks, etc.

Elisa has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from selling pre-paid mobile load (pre-paid cellular telephone credits).

Elisa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married with three children who are adult and school-ages. Marilyn is 54 years old and lives in Lilo-an, Maria, Siquijor.
Marilyn engaged in food vending to earn a living and had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000.00 to purchase additional vegetables and fruits such as potatoes and carrots. 
Marilyn is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Marilyn hopes to expand her business with this institution.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with four children who are adult and school-ages. Josephine is 46 years old and lives in Lilo-an, Maria, Siquijor.
Josephine engaged in food vending to earn a living and had this business for eight years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,500.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000.00 to purchase additional vegetables and fruits such as potatoes and carrots.
Josephine is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Josephine hopes to expand her business with this institution.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married with three children. She is 57 years old and lives in Centro Napu,Tudela,Philippines.
Norma  is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional feed for her pigs.
Norma has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Norma hopes to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is married with 4 children. Jenifer  is 27 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines.

Jenifer sells a variety of products to earn a living and has had this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

Jenifer has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Jenifer hope to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Nila María

texts.es:
La Señora. Nila desde hace algún tiempo forma parte del grupo de crédito La Paz, grupo de crédito que le gusta por la unión y compañerismo existente, ya que es un grupo muy organizado y todos tiene un mismo objetivo el cual es mejorar la calidad de vida en sus hogares. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca lugar que goza de una belleza tanto natural como arquitectónica, su gastronomía es muy variada y cautiva el paladar de quienes la visitan, esta ciudad también es cuna de grande escritores como deportistas.

Doña Nila tiene 48 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos, tres de sus hijos son casados, tres trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su último hijo de 8 años estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a la alfarería, la casa en la que viven es propia.

La Señora. Nila trabaja diariamente en la alfarería, trabajo en el que se encuentra desde hace 25 años, en este negocio se inicio gracias a su esposo quien sabia de este arte y ahora ya forma parte del trabajo familiar. 

Su crédito anterior lo invertido en la compra de materia prima, del cual obtuvo muy buenas ganancias. Esta repitiendo el crédito pues lo va a invertir en la compra de pinturas, figuras de barro y arcilla que necesita para la elaboración de sus artesanías.
texts.en:
Nila has been part of the “La Paz” credit group for some time now.  She likes it because of the unity and companionship that exists since it’s a very organized group and everyone has the same objective which is to improve the quality of life at home.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a place that enjoys natural and architectonic beauty; it has a varied cuisine that captivates all who visit it.  This is a city that’s also the birthplace of great writers and sports figures.

Nila is 48-years-old and in her marriage has had 7 children.  Three of her children are married, three work and help her out economically and her youngest who is 8-years-old attends the little local school.  Her husband works in pottery making and they own the house they live in.

Nila works every day making pottery, work she’s been doing for the last 25 years.  She started in this business thanks to her husband who knew this art and she now participates in this family business.

She used her previous loan to buy raw materials and earned very good profits.  She’s repeating the loan since she’ll use it to buy paint, clay figurines and clay she needs to manufacture her crafts.

loans.use: to buy paint, clay figurines and clay.

loans.name: Maa Durga Group

texts.en:
The name of this group is “Maa Durga” .This group was formed in the year 2010 by five women members of Below Poverty Line category from the village Kalsaipali in the district of Bolangir in Odisha; India to access loans from Mahashakti Foundation. Kalsaipali is a small rural village located five kilometers away from the district headquarters of Balangir.  All households of this village belong to the milkman community and their main income source is milk selling, along with cultivation. Sankar is one of the members of this group. She is standing second from the right with raised hand in the photo. She is 44 years old; living with her husband and two sons aged 18 & 12 years. 

Sankar is running her conventional business of milk selling, having five cows. She gets 15 liters of milk per day. Her husband supplies this milk to the households of the railway colony of the town. Apart from this her family cultivates vegetables in the backyard and her elder son has been running a mobile phone repair centre at Balangir town for the last two years. From the above businesses Sankar gets a monthly income of 10,000 INR. But according to Sankar, the present income is insufficient and she faces lots of financial troubles in covering fodder expenses, investment in the mobile repair center and household expenses.  So, as there is growing demand for milk in the locality, she has planned to utilize the present loan for purchasing another cow of improved variety to add some extra income to her family. Sankar says this will help her to provide some financial help to her son and save some money for the construction of a house and digging a well for vegetable cultivation. Sankar has also a dream to develop a dairy farm in future.

The other four members of this group are Ulas, Surubali, Sasthi and Brundabati with similar milk businesses.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing a cow.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Group

texts.en:
Dipanjali is 30 years old and lives in Kalsaipali village of Balangir district of Odisha, India. Kalsaipali is a rural village located nearest to Balangir town. The lady standing second from the left with raised hand in the photograph is Dipanjali. She is young and a very active and energetic lady. She lives with her husband and one son of three years. She belongs to a poor family. 

Dipanjali has been running a general store in her village for the last twelve years with the active help of her husband. Her husband manages the general store and Dipanjali helps him as and when needed. In the general store they  sell general grocery items like oil, sugar, tea, soap, washing powder, lentils, biscuits, toffees, eggs, etc. Her net monthly income from the existing business is 5000 INR. Out of this income she can hardly cover her business as well as household expenses. 

Dipanjali’s husband purchases stock for her business on daily basis from the wholesalers of the nearest town of 5 kms away. For this he has to spend a lot of time which hampers the business. To remedy the present situation, she wants to increase stock of her business. Therefore Dipanjali formed a group with five other members of her village to access loans from Mahashakti Foundation. From this loan amount of 10,000 INR she wants to purchase items like lentils, soap, biscuits, spice items, etc. Dipanjali hopes this will help her to increase her income to make her dreams of construction of a house, purchasing a bike and better education of her only child come true.
 
The other five borrowers of the group are Kunti with a general shop business and Belmati, Ratna, Sadei and Sita with milk businesses.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing lentils, soap, biscuits, spice items, etc.

loans.name: Jerame

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jerame works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Jerame is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell for her business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Jerame has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, noodles, eggs, etc., for her general store business.  Norma has been in this business for 5 years. Norma earns more income from pig fattening.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
Las 14 integrantes de este comité son mujeres muy trabajadoras que están saliendo adelante, están luchando por sus familias ya que quieren darles el futuro que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una persona digna de destacar es la Sra. Leida, quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas en general, comenta que con su negocio mantiene a su familia, ya que es su principal sustento. Está creciendo gracias al sacrificio que está haciendo. Comenta también que los fines de semana es cuando más ventas tiene, y es por eso que está pidiendo de crédito, para poder invertirlo en la compra de vinos, gaseosas, cervezas y demás bebidas. Agradece por esta oportunidad que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The 14 members of this committee are very hardworking women who are moving ahead striving for their families because they want to provide them with the future they themselves were unable to have.

One person worthy of note is Leida who sells beverages in general.  She comments that she supports her family with her business since it’s her main source of support.  She’s growing thanks to the sacrifice she’s making.  

She also comments that her best sales are on weekends and this is why she’s asking for the loan to be able to use it to buy wine, soft-drinks, beer and other beverages.  She’s grateful for this opportunity she and her friends are receiving.

loans.use: to buy beverages.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Guapa está en su Primer ciclo  del programa de comité, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 3 de las integrantes están con ingresos muy bajos, tratando de mejorar por medio de su trabajo.
Mariela es una de las integrantes, quien por medio de la venta de helados tiene los ingresos para ayudar a su familia. Es una persona muy emprendedora, que con su esfuerzo y su sacrificio ha venido creciendo. Hoy ella pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de helados, con lo que podrá seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y mejorando su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Guapa” group is in its first cycle in the committee program and are taking the poverty elimination survey; three of the members are very low income and trying to improve by means of their work.

Mariela is one of the members who by means of selling frozen treats earns income to help her family.  She’s a very enterprising person who with effort and sacrifice has been growing.  Today, she’s requesting this loan to buy frozen treats to continue investing in her business and improving her undertaking.

loans.use: to buy frozen treats to sell.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen del Carmen 2  está en su 7mo ciclo, 3 de estas mujeres están con ingresos muy bajos según la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza que las integrantes han hecho. Son mujeres con mucho entusiasmo y quieren salir adelante por medio de su trabajo.
Erodita, una de las integrantes, se dedica a la costura, y con su trabajo está ayudando a su familia. Ella hizo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, lo que mostró que ella se encuentra con ingresos muy escasos, pero es por ello que Erodita se está esforzando mas para ir creciendo. Ella solicita de este crédito para poder seguir con su costura, y poder comprar telas e hilos. Todas las integrantes están agradecidas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo, pues les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group called Virgen del Carmen 2 is in its seventh cycle. Three of these women have very low incomes according to the poverty elimination survey that the members have taken. They are women with a lot of enthusiasm and they want to move ahead through their work.

Erodita, one of the members, is a dressmaker, and with her work she is helping her family. She took the poverty elimination survey, which showed that she has very little income, but that is why Erodita is making an effort to grow. She is asking for this loan in order to be able to continue with her dressmaking and to be able to buy cloth and thread. All of the members are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving, since it will be of great help to them.

loans.use: to buy cloth and thread

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelle à N’TESSONI, l’un des villages de la 3ème région administrative du Mali (Sikasso). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne agricole avec l’institution et le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autre: l’arachide, le mais et le pois sucré.
Avec  MAH 1ère personne à gauche de la photo position assise,avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des engrais  pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et au marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 95.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "BENKADI II" are married women, who average 47 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in N’TESSONI, a village in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali (Sikasso). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their second farm loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crops grown include peanuts, corn, and sweet peas, as is the case with MAH, who is standing first from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase fertilizer to maintain 0.5 hectare. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in the village and at the market.

She plans on making a profit of 95,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
