Cherry is 35 years old and married, with one child.

Cherry works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like biscuits, canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, and shampoo.

Cherry has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

Cherry aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like biscuits, canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, and shampoo.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is from Goris where he lives together with his daughter. For many years he has specialized in breeding cattle, and his livestock currently includes cows, pigs and piglets. He earns an income by selling his animals in a market to local butchers.

Robert would like to increase his livestock by one cow, so he has applied for a 3,000 USD loan through SEF International to do so. He will also use part of the loan to buy forage for his animals.

Robert works hard to ensure a better life for his beloved daughter. He hopes for lenders' support so he can do so.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage for his livestock

loans.name: Voskan

texts.en:
Voskan has been involved in agriculture for ten years. He lives in Odzun village of the Lori region with his wife (in the photo) and 4-year-old daughter. Currently his farm includes cows, chickens and beehives, as well as cultivation of wheat and potatoes. Voskan's wife helps him with the farming business and takes care of their little daughter.

As agriculture is the main source of income for the family, Voskan would like to expand it. He has applied for this loan for purchasing two calves and forage for feeding the livestock.

The loan will greatly assist Voskan to gather more agricultural income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for two calves and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Artem

texts.en:
Artem is a hardworking farmer from Berdashen village. He has been running a farm for many years and specializes in cattle breeding. Near the village where Artem and his family live, he owns a small plot of arable land where he cultivates grass for feeding the livestock.

Artem does his best to sustain his wife's and children’s living. Artem sells the gathered agricultural products to local retailers and gathers income, which is vital for him.

By applying for this loan, Artem would like to increase his livestock by one cow. It is very important for Artem to enlarge his farm and ensure a better future for his beloved family.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor de 56 años de edad, es casado y padre de 4 hijos. Se a dedicado a trabajar desde muy pequeño, ya que proviene de una familia bastante numerosa y de bajos recursos económicos, tenían que ayudar a su padre y mantener la familia, cultivaban hasta 28,000 metros cuadrados. Debido a la situación económica no le pudieron sus padres dar ningún estudio académico, debido a que lo importante era trabajar todos los días la agricultura y trabajar como jornal.

 cuando se caso a los 26 años, de esta unión procrearon 4 hijos a todos ellos con mucho esfuerzo los a enviado a estudiar, los menores están cursando primaria y el mayor le ayuda en sus actividades pero no a cumplido la mayoría de edad, todos dependen de su trabajo agrícola y otros trabajos como jornalero  que realiza para ganar dinero para su familia. 

Ademas, con mucho trabajo a través de un crédito adquirió una yunta de bueyes, con los que trabaja haciendo viajes y trabajos agrícolas, sus trabajos los hace cerca de casa; pero siempre madruga para terminar las labores agrícolas.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para la compra de insumos agrícolas: abonos, fertilizantes, pago de mosos y para preparar la tierra para el cultivo de 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Su objetivo, es seguir trabajando y brindarles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Víctor is 56 years old, married, and has four children.  He has worked since he was very young, since he came from a very large family with limited financial resources.  He had to help his father and support his family by cultivating 28,000 square meters.  Due to their financial situation, his parents were not able to send him to school, since it was important to work every day in the fields and work as a day laborer.  

When he married at 26, he had four children, all of whom he made an effort to send to school.  The youngest are in primary school and the oldest helps with his work, but he is not yet an adult.  They all depend on his farming work and other jobs as a day laborer that he does to earn money for his family.  

He received a loan, and with a lot of work, was able to purchase a pair of oxen that work making trips and doing farm work.  He does his work close to the house, but he always gets up at dawn to finish his farm work.  

He will use the funds from the loan to purchase farming supplies: manure, fertilizer, biochar, and to prepare the land to plan 7,000 square meters of corn.  His objective is to continue working and send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer, pay for biochar, and to prepare the land to plant 7,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa, de 45 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Martín con quien tiene 5 hijos todos menores de edad, a los que cuida en su casa propia. Teresa se dedica a la agricultura, como todos los días se dirge muy temprano a cuidar de sus sembríos de papa, alverja y maíz, comenta que puede sembrar gran variedad de hortalizas pues tiene riego a disposición y ello la incentiva a sembrar en cualquier temporada del año. Ahora espera la cosecha de maíz pues tiene compradores que ya revisarón sus sembríos y los quieren comprar. Como ella es una mujer trabajadora también cuenta con vacas, toros y cerdos los cuales comercializa de manera constante, ya que la carne que producen son de buena calidad. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por lo espera continuar con su apoyo financiero, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Teresa, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Forty-five year old Teresa is a simple woman.  She lives in the company of her husband, Martín, with whom she has 5 minor children, whom she cares for in her own home.

Teresa makes her living in agriculture, and everyday, she heads out very early to care for her fields of potatoes, peas and corn.  She says that she can plant a wide variety of vegetables because she has irrigation at her disposal, and that allows her to plant at any time of year.  Now she is waiting for the corn harvest because she has buyers who already inspected her fields and want to buy her produce.  

Since she is a hardworking woman, she also has cows, bulls and pigs, which she sells continuously, since the meat that they produce is of good quality.  

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she hopes to continue with the financial support.  She also is committed to making her payments on time.  Teresa will invest the 1500 soles in the purchase of organic compost to nourish her fields.

loans.use: to buy organic compost.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 60 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell.

Teresa has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from tricycle transportation.

Teresa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana is sixty years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari, or general store in the Philippines.

Valeriana has previously borrowed and paid off nine loans from NWTF. She is now applying for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock such as canned goods, rice, food, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Valeriana aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling coconut wine in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 23 years now.

Avelina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

In the future, Avelina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Lucewin

texts.en:
Lucewin is 43 years old and married with five children. With all five children currently in school, Lucewin works very hard to provide for them.

Lucewin runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, noodles, etc. in her general store.

Lucewin has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, milk, coffee, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Lucewin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is married with two children. Josefina is 48 years old and has 1 child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Josefina has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. Josefina requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

Josefina has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Josefina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 49 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Lucia is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucia has been in pig fattening for 25 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Akmaral

texts.en:
Akmaral is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia. 

She wants to start a career in business. She is from Chuy, Kyrgyzstan, where she sees the problems of unemployment in her community. By studying at AUCA, Akmaral will be able to get the skills and inspiration she needs to be an entrepreneur for her community. Akmaral is also very active in sports. During her studies in high school, she was also very active in tourism and had a good reputation among her classmates. Akmaral was very sociable and active in other social activities at school. Therefore, Akmaral could play an active role in the extracurricular activities of AUCA, where she could practice her leadership skills. 

Akmaral is not able to afford full tuition at AUCA, that's why she needs a KIVA loan to cover it.

After graduation, Akmaral will be able to become independent. Thus, she will help both her parents and her community.

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet is from Basen village of the Shirak region. He is a hard-working farmer and a lovely father of three children (in the photo). 

Hamlet runs a farm which includes 200 sheep and he cultivates wheat, barley, and grass. The gathered harvest is sold in the city market. Hamlet is supporting his family's living by the income from agriculture, so the farming business is very important to him. Years ago, he enlarged the arable land he owned and now he is able to cultivate more.

Unfortunately, in the community where Hamlet lives, there is not much agricultural equipment that will help farmers with cultivation. So, this enthusiastic farmer, with good credit history behind him, has applied to SEF International for a loan.

With the loan's help, Hamlet plans to purchase a plow to support the cultivation process. This will ease Hamlet's work and he will be able to improve his life.

loans.use: to pay for a plow to support the cultivation process.

loans.name: Legena

texts.en:
Legena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct selling personal collection products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like laundry soap, lotion, perfume, bath soap, etc. for her direct selling personal collection products business.

Legena has been in this business for 5 years. Legena earns more income from pig fattening.

Legena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as laundry soap, lotion, perfume, and bath soap

loans.name: Ma. Violeta

texts.en:
Ma. Violeta works hard to support her family. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Violeta has been in this business for five years now.

Ma. Violeta requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Socorro

texts.en:
Ma. Socorro works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Socorro has been in this business for three years now.

Ma. Socorro requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, egg, noodles, milk, soap, etc. In the future, she would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, egg, noodles, milk, soap, etc.

loans.name: Mercelita

texts.en:
Mercelita is 51 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mercelita has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Mercelita requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional goods like milk, bread, cereals, soft-drinks, canned goods, biscuits and other groceries to sell in her general store. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like milk, bread, cereals, soft-drinks, canned goods, biscuits, and other groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Taciana

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Taciana works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Taciana is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabrics, threads, zippers, etc. for her tailoring business.

Taciana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabrics, threads, zippers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Melva works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Melva is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Melva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 47 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 40,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like sugar, shampoo, soap, canned goods and chips to sell.

Mercedita has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Mercedita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as sugar, shampoo, soap, canned goods and chips

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as noodles and soap to sell. Patricia has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from farming sugarcane.

Patricia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like noodles and soap to sell

loans.name: Iñilena

texts.en:
Iñilena is 56 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Iñilena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy household goods to sell like sugar, coffee, milk, can goods, etc.

Iñilena has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Iñilena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy household goods to sell like sugar, coffee, milk, can goods, etc.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 61 years old and married with 10 children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marie has been farming rice for two years and also earns additional income from general store.

Marie is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 30 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines and she has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from rice retailing.

Maricel requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like diapers, powdered soap, school supplies, candies, groceries, etc. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like diapers, powdered soap, school supplies, candies, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Mary May

texts.en:
Mary May is 33 years old and married with three children, one of whom in school. Mary May works very hard to provide for them.

Mary May runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like coffee, candies, can goods, chips, egg, etc.

Mary May has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future Mary May would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like coffee, candies, can goods, chips, egg, etc.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Nonita works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and farming rice. 

Nonita is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business like meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her restaurant business.

Nonita has sustained her business activities with her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business like meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is single and has a business buying and selling scrap materials in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years now. Thelma works hard to support her family. 

Thelma requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more scrap to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap to sell

loans.name: Cristina Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Cristina is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

Hello, my name is Cristina, and I am 29 years old, married, and have three kids: Jennifer is 11, Alberto is 6 and Violeta is 1 year old. My son Alberto has a learning disability, so I will use the loan to pay for some treatment and special care that he needs. I am willing to work very hard to provide my son with the best education and healthcare that I can. I work in a company that provides roadside assistance and my husband works in the same company.

loans.use: to pay for education and health care for her special needs son.

loans.name: Zenny

texts.en:
Zenny is 28 years old and has one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family. Zenny runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for one year. 

Zenny requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, baby powder, groceries, etc. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, baby powder, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Isatu S.

texts.en: Isatu is 39 years old, married, and the mother of four children who are 20, 15, 12, and 8 years old. All of her children attend school and she supports her family by selling tie-dyed clothing. She began her business in 2005 because she was unable to complete secondary school due to a lack of financial support. She worked for her mother for several years, but when she became an adult her mother gave her enough money to start her own business. Today, she works seven days a week, 10 hours a day and earns about 840,000 SLL a month. She is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 SLL to buy various tie-dyed items to sell to her customers. Her goals for the future are to buy a piece of land, educate her children and expand her business.  This loan will help her accomplish these goals. She is a hard-working businesswoman and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy tie-dyed items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria Rita

texts.en:
Maria Rita is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

My name is Rita, I have been married for 24 years and have three sons. I live with my mother-in-law, enjoy sales and also like to dance. My business is catalog sales, which I have been doing for the last 24 years. I have a portfolio of more than 100 recurring clients who buy from me and refer me to their friends and family.

I will use the loan to buy more inventory and that way I will be able to increase my sales. I give credit to my clients, so I need working capital to continue to finance inventory. My biggest accomplishment is that I have won many awards for outstanding sales. I consider my self credit-worthy because I honor my commitments and pay on time.

loans.use: To buy products for reselling through a catalog (door to door).

loans.name: Yeranuhi

texts.en:
Yeranuhi is from Hovtun village where she lives with her son and daughter and takes care of her four grandchildren. Yeranuhi has been involved in the farming business for many years. In particular, she runs a farm which includes cows, sheep, pigs, piglets, and chickens. Yeranuhi also owns a small piece of arable land where barley and grass are cultivated. Yeranuhi milks cows and makes cheese. She works hard to sustain her family. 

Realizing that agriculture is the only source of the family's income, Yeranuhi would like to increase the number of her livestock. She has applied for this loan to purchase six calves and forage for feeding the livestock. Yeranuhi hopes for lenders' support as this loan will greatly assist her in improving her family's poor living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for six calves and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is 28 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Angelie is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Angelie has been in this business for two years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Angelie would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Gulgumcha

texts.ru: Гулгумча добрая женщина. Она имеет трудную судьбу. Ее муж умер, и она не имеет детей. Ей было очень трудно жить после смерти мужа. Гулгумча набралась сил и продолжала жить. Она более 7 лет работает в кардиологическом центре в должности справочника. Она имеет высшее образование. Она умная и начитанная женщина. Данное время она живет вместе с сестрой в старом домике. Она уже несколько лет планирует отремонтировать дом, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, алебастер, эмульция и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulgumcha is a kind woman.  She has had a difficult fate; her husband died and she doesn't have any children.  Life has been very hard for her after the death of her husband.  Gulgumcha has found the strength to continue living.  For more than seven years, she has been working in a cardiology center as  a docent.  She has a high school education.  She is an intelligent and well-read woman.  Recently, she has been living with her sister in an old house.  For a few years, she has planned to make repairs to the home, but she hasn't had any money.  She is asking for a loan of $500 to buy building materials like cement, alabaster, paint, etc.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cement, alabaster and other materials for repairing her house

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine works hard to support four children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Geraldine requested a PHP 4600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend ther business hours even after nightfall.

Geraldine is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. Delia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Delia is borrowing PHP 4600  through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Delia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, she helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Jose Tulio

texts.es:
Julio, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en su actividad; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar herramientas para la carpintería, tales como: taladro entre otros.
Cuenta el Sr. Julio que el crédito anterior le permitió incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos. Las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual, mientras que las condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en:
Jose Tulio finds himself in the need of another loan, since he needs more working capital in order to continue investing in his activity. This investment will help him to buy tools for his carpentry business, such as a drill among other things.

Jose Tulio says that the previous loan allowed him to increase his inventory and obtain a higher income. His family's situation remains the same, whereas his economic conditions have improved.

loans.use: to buy tools, such as a drill among other things

loans.name: Maria Itzel Rocio

texts.en:
Maria Itzel is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

Hello, my name is Maria Itzel. I am 42 years old and live in Valle de Chalco in Mexico City. I am married and have two small children that go to school. We all live in my mother´s house.

I will use the loan to buy inventory for the new season. I sell girl's clothes and like to have an up-to-date inventory for each season. I sell in flea markets and have been doing so for the last twenty years, so I have many recurring clients. My biggest accomplishment is being an independent woman that through hard work and dedication has been able to start and sustain a business. My next goal is to buy my own house.

loans.use: To buy inventory such as girls clothes

loans.name: Caritas Felices Group

texts.es: El grupo “CARITAS FELICES” está conformada por 09 mujeres quienes día a día trabajan para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Yolinda tiene 29 años es conviviente con 1 hijo educando y otro en espera. Yolinda se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y zapatillas para niños  hace 02 años. Años atrás se dedicaba a su casa. Es de esta manera que Yolinda apoya a su esposos con los gastos de su familia. el préstamo lo invirtió en la compra de ropa, zapatos y zapatillas. yolinda tiene un nuevo objetivo el cual es comprar un stand en donde trabajar tranquila. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Yolinda es la primera persona  parada del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: The group Caritas Felices is made of 9 women who work day after day to improve their family's quality of life. Yolinda is 29 years old and lives with her son, who goes to school, and another on the way. Yolinda sells clothing, shoes and slippers for children, a business she has ran for 2 years. Years ago, she started her business from home. Her work helps her to support her husband with family expenses. The loan will be invested in purchasing clothing, shoes and slippers. Yolinda's new goal is to purchase a stand where she can work comfortably. The group thanks the investors at Kiva for the loan. Yolinda is the first person standing on the left.

loans.use: purchase clothing, shoes and slippers.

loans.name: Laurel

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Laurel works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns income from food vending and a general store. Laurel is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to purchase materials like paint, wood and bamboo to repair her fishing boat.

Laurel has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save more money, so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase materials like paint, wood and bamboo to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 53 years old and has one child in school. Virginia works very hard to provide for her family.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods like sugar, chips, canned goods, eggs and noodles.

Virginia has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of household goods like sugar, chips, canned goods, eggs and noodles.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store.  Nenita is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell for her business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 60 years old and married with two children. Virginia works very hard to provide for them.

Virginia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Virginia has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, sugar, candies and noodles. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Virginia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венере 28 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 сына. У Венеры - высшее педагогическое образование, в данное время работает наставницей в детском саду, в поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Венера занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Венеры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 38 овец, 1 жеребец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Венера обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров, с дальнейшим откормом и перепродажей. Доходы от кредита Венера планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Venera is 28 years old and she is married with one son.  She has a higher pedagogical education and at the moment she works as a mentor in a kindergarten.  As an extra source of income for her family, Venera is involved in raising livestock.  She started ten years ago with the purchase of animals for 15,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, her farm now has one dairy cow, 38 sheep and one stallion.  Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Venera turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to fatten and resell.  She plans to reinvest the income from this loan back into increasing the size of her herd, and she plans on saving up some money to make repairs on her home.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story.

Hi my name is Tomas, I am 36 years old, have been married for 8 years but don´t have sons. I sell women's clothes in flea markets, usually working 5 days a week from 7 am to 6 pm. I will use the loan for inventory, by having more product variety I can increase sales. I have been doing this work for the last 20 years and fortunately have been able to grow the business, achieve some financial stability and pay my debts on time.

My biggest accomplishments are buying my apartment, a car and a piece of land. My next goal is building a house.

loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story.

Hi my name is Santiago, I am 38 years old, married and have two kids. I have a grocery store in front of some schools. I opened almost 14 years ago and fortunately I have been able to make it grow. I am always looking for ways to improve it and make my business grow. I want to use the loan to refurbish the store and making it safer from thieves, also to buy some groceries and other inventory.

I believe I am credit-worthy, because I have had loans in the past and have always payed on time.

loans.use: to refurbish the store and buy inventory

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is from Metsamor village of Armavir region. She has been working as a director of a local kindergarden for many years and also keeps 100 colonies of bees. Gayane gets high quality honey and sells it locally. Due to her hard work, the honey that Gayane produces is in high demand in the region.
By applying for this loan she would like to increase by 10 the number of bee colonies.
The loan is important for her to enlarge her business and earn more income.
 The loan will greatly support Gayane so she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for 10 colonies of bees

loans.name: Repaja

texts.en:
Repaja is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a coconut wine business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy additional gallons of coconut wine to sell for her business.

Repaja has been in this business for 18 years. Repaja earns additional income from food vending.

Repaja has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons of  coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Angel

texts.es: Ángel es un joven de 20 años, es soltero y vive junto a su hermanos en la casa de sus padres. Angel se dedica a la agricultura en las parcelas de sus padres a quienes vienen apoyando desde muy jóvenes ya que el trabajo de la agricultura es un trabajo colectivo. Ángel le brinda un buen mantenimiento a sus tierras para obtener una buena producción. Ángel cuenta con el apoyo directo de sus hermanos ya no necesita contratar a trabajadores del lugar logrando usar ese dinero para el normal desempeño de su trabajo. Tras una larga campaña y con la llegada de la cosecha deben recolectar las mazorcas de cacao maduras para partirlos y extraer las almendras de cacao que serán secadas al sol para luego llevarlo a los centros de venta en cual está ubicado en su localidad logrando recuperar el dinero que invirtió con las respectivas ganancias. Este es su segundo crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea solicitar 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico y preparar sus tierras para los nuevos sembríos.
texts.en:
Angel, 20, is single and lives with his siblings in his parent's house. Angel is a farmer on his parent's plots of land. He has been helping them since he was very young since agricultural work is collective work. 

Angel provides good upkeep on the lands to obtain a good production. Angel's siblings support him so he no longer needs to hire workers; using that money for the regular performance of his work. After a long season and with the arrival of the harvest they must collect ripe cocoa pods, open them and extract the cocoa beans that will be dried in the sun and later taken to sale centers located in his area; he recuperates the money that he invested with respective gains. 

This is his second loan with Kiva and he is thankful for the financial support he is receiving to continue ahead. In addition, he promises to pay his monthly payments on time. At this time he wants to request 2,000 Peruvian Soles to purchase organic fertilizer and to prepare the lands for the new crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 64 years old, married and has four children. 

Norma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Norma has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. Vilma is married and has a business raising pigs in the Philippines.

Vilma requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Vilma has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Tursunay

texts.ru: Турсунай 64 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Турсунай - среднее образование, в поисках основного дохода для своей семьи Турсунай занимается животноводством, стартовав 24 года назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Турсунай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Турсунай обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров, с дальнейшим откормом и перепродажей. Доходы от кредита Турсунай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Tursunay is 64 years old and she is married with four children.  She has a high school education and she raises livestock as the main source of income for her family.  She started 24 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 3,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work, Tursunay now has two dairy cows and 15 sheep on her farm.  Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Tursunay turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to fatten and resell.  She plans to reinvest the income from this loan back into her business by further increasing her head of livestock, and she plans to save up money to make repairs to her home.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening and resale

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from Meghrashat village. She lives with her three school-age children and her husband.
As a hard-working Armenian woman, Anahit does her best to cover her family's basic costs by running her farm. She breeds livestock (cows, sheep, chickens), keeps colonies of bees and cultivates wheat, barley and grass.
Anahit's son is 12 years old and helps his mother with farming. The family has many daily costs that hinders the farming business. By applying for this loan, Anahit asks for support. She needs a loan of USD 2200 in order to hire workers for gathering the harvest. As the family has no farm machinery, it is very difficult for Anahit to arrange for cultivation. Anahit will also purchase forage for feeding the livestock.
Anahit hopes for lenders' support as the loan will greatly help her and her family.

loans.use: to pay for covering cultivation costs and purchase forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Asiatu

texts.en: This is 50 year-old Asiatu.  She is single, and has no child.  In 2005, Asiatu established her commercial plastic shoe business. She began her business because she wanted to be self supportive. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Asiatu requires a loan in order to buy cartons of slippers and assorted sandals. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 800,000. In the future, Asiatu plans to be an agent of the slippers factory in Guinea. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cartons of slippers and assorted sandals.

loans.name: Hayrinisso

texts.ru: Хайриниссо 38 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж пенсионер. Она более 15 лет работает техничкой в государственной организации. Ее дети еще не имеют источника дохода. Двое из ее детей школьники. Ее старший сын в этом году поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет. Хайриниссо старается для того, чтобы ее дети получили хорошее образование. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына, но не имеет денег. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Hayrinisso is 38 years old and she is married with three children.  Her husband is retired.  For more than 15 years, she has been working as a cleaner in a government office.  Her children do not yet have a source of income.  Two of her children are in school and her eldest son was offered a place at Tajikistan State University this year.  Hayrinisso tries to do everything she can to make sure her children receive a good education.  She needs to pay for her son's tuition, but she doesn't have the money.  She is awaiting your kindness and counting on your charity.

loans.use: To pay for her son's tuition

loans.name: Sher

texts.ru:
Шер является скотоводом из города Куляб. Ему 50 лет. Он занимается животноводческим бизнесом на протяжении 3-х лет. Он верный муж и прекрасный отец четырех детей. У него два сына и две дочери. Шер занимается куплей и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Он получил ремесло от своего отца. Он тоже был скотоводом. 
Шер просит кредит для закупа бычков и телят для увеличения поголовья скота и развития бизнеса. Шер никогда не боялся трудиться и таким он воспитал своих детей. Один сын помогает ему в деятельности, а второй сын находится на заработках в России. Его жена и дочери ведут домашнее хозяйство. 
Полученную прибыль с деятельности Шер хочет потратить на улучшения быта и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Sher is a cattle farmer from the city of Kulyab. He is 50 and has been working in animal husbandry for three years. He is a loyal husband and wonderful father of four children, two sons and two daughters. Sher works as a buyer and seller of big-horned cattle. He learned the profession from his father, who was also a cattle farmer.

Sher is requesting a loan to buy steers and calves to increase his head count of cattle and develop his business. He has never been afraid of hard work and this is the way he has raised his children. One son helps him with his work and the other is a migrant worker in Russia. His wife and daughters take care of the house.

Sher wants to spend the profits received on improving his way of life and on home renovations.

loans.use: to buy steers and calves to increase his number of cattle and develop his business

loans.name: Claudia Vanessa

texts.es:
Claudia, es una persona de hogar, está casada y vive con su madre, disfruta de dos hijos. Ella, posee una tienda y anteriormente era empleada de una panadería, posteriormente por iniciativa propia decidió colocar dicha tienda, la estableció mas cuando se caso, esta actividad la realiza desde hace tres años.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar variedad de mercadería, tales como: frijoles, arroz, azúcar, sal, detergentes, golosinas, bebidas, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a surtir la tienda y agregar otros productos, mejorar las ventas.
Su sueño es ampliar el negocio; asimismo ampliar la vivienda y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia likes being at home, she is married and lives with her mother, she enjoys her two children. She owns a store and previously she was a bakery employee. Later, on her own initiative, she decided to set up the store. She consolidated it further once she got married, and she has been running this business for three years. 

The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy a variety of merchandise, such as beans, rice, sugar, salt, detergent, sweets, drinks, etc. This investment will help her to stock her store and add more products, improving her sales. 

Her dream is to expand the business, as well as to make her house bigger and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, sugar, salt, detergent, sweets, drinks, etc

loans.name: Valeriy

texts.ru:
Валерий женат, имеет троих детей. Зарабатывает тем, что выращивает овощи и поросят на продажу. Валерию нужен кредит для улучшения жилищных условий. Он хочет сделать ремонт в ванной комнате - выравнивание стен, кладка кафеля, повесной потолок и замена дверей) и частичный ремонт в кухне. Валерий - пастор небольшой церкви.

Примечание: на фото Валерий со своей супругой
texts.en:
Valeriy is married and has three children. He earns money by raising and selling vegetables and piglets. He needs a loan to improve his living conditions. He wants to renovate his bathroom (levelling walls, laying tile, a suspended ceiling and replacing the doors) and part of his kitchen. Valeriy is the pastor of a small church.

Note: in the photo are Valeriy and his wife

loans.use: to renovate his bathroom and kitchen

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es: Demetrio es un hombre de 47 años, está casado con Victoria y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa cosntruida a base de adobe. Demetrio se dedica a la agricultura en sus terrenos agrícolas en donde tiene diversos productos rentables de su zona como  plantas de cacao, café y plátano. Lleva 20 años desempeñandose a está actividad. Siempre cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa y en tiempos de cosecha contrata a trabajadores del lugar para agilizar sus cultivos y venderlo a los compradores. Los terrenos de cultivo que tiene actualmente son el fruto de su esfuerzo. Su principal inconveniente es el tema del trasporteya que sus terrenos se encuentran alejados de la ciudad pero esto no lo desanima a seguir adelante. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está ocasion desea solicitar S/.1,000 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico y nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Demetrio, 47, is married to Victoria and they have 2 children whom live with them in their house made of adobe. Demetrio is a farmer and works on his lands where he has diverse profitable products in his area such as cocoa, coffee and banana plants. He has been doing this work for 20 years. He always has the support of his wife and at harvest time he hires workers to speed up the cultivation and to sell the products to buyers. The lands that he has at the moment are the result of his efforts. His main problem is transport as his lands are in remote areas but this doesn't discourage him to continue on. 

This is his first loan with Kiva and he is thankful for the financial support he is receiving to continue ahead. In addition, he promises to pay his monthly payments on time. At this time he wishes to request 1,000 Peruvian Soles to purchase organic fertilizer and to nourish his sown fields.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for his sown fields.

loans.name: Orlando De Jesús

texts.es: Orlando, a sus 36 años de edad, es propietario de una miscelánea donde ofrece gran variedad de artículos como zapatos, productos de aseo, artículos de papelería, juguetes, entre otros. Su idea de negocio surgió por la necesidad de generar ingresos para solventar los gastos de su hogar, ya que hacen parte de un grupo de víctimas de desplazamiento forzado, debido a la violencia que se presentó en su pueblo natal; en compañía de su familia llega a la ciudad en busca de nuevas oportunidades para comenzar desde cero y poder salir adelante.  El cliente es un hombre trabajador, pujante y lucha incansablemente para lograr sus objetivos. Esto lo motiva a solicitar el crédito, que invertirá en la compra de surtido al por mayor (juguetería, accesorios para el hogar, productos de aseo, entre otros) y realizar adecuaciones locativas (arreglar la fachada del local), de esta manera el establecimiento tendrá una mejor imagen, que sea atractiva para los transeúntes, además podrá capitalizar su negocio con gran variedad de artículos que satisfagan los gustos y requerimientos del público que lo visita, aumentando sus ventas y el margen de ganancia que obtiene. Esto le permitirá tener una mayor solvencia económica para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hogar.
texts.en: Orlando is 36 years old and owns a miscellaneous items store, where he sells a variety of items such as shoes, toiletries, paper goods, toys, and other things.  He got the idea for this business from the need to generate an income to pay the household expenses.  He is part of a group of persons who had to resettle because of the violence that had developed in his home village.  He arrived in the city with his family, in search of new opportunities to start over.  He is asking for a loan so he can buy inventory in quantity (toys, home accessories, toiletries, and other things) and make some improvements to his store (fix the façade) so that it presents a better image and so that it will be attractive to passersby.  He will also be able to stock his store with items that will satisfy the needs and wants of people who visit and increase his sales.  This will allow him to have better financial solvency and living conditions at home.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Luzdina

texts.es:
Luzdina, de 40 años de edad, está divorciada del padre de sus 4 hijos de 22, 20, 16 y 14 años de edad. Todos instalados cómodamente en su casa propia. La ciudad de Pucallpa tiene un clima muy caluroso, esta característica hace que sus pobladores estén en búsqueda constante de distintos postres refrescantes. Es por eso que Luzdina prepara a diario gelatinas y helados elaborados con las mejores frutas tropicales. Tiene una refrigeradora en su casa en donde congela los productos que elabora y hasta su vivienda llegan sus clientes a comprar los deliciosos postres. Lleva 5 años en esta actividad, tiempo que le ha servido para acentuar el gusto y sabor perfecto que caracterizan a sus postres. Trabaja siempre sola, ya que su labor no requiere de mucho esfuerzo en la atención, sin embargo en la preparación de los dulces a veces es necesario contar con la ayuda de alguna de su hijas, lo que más la pone feliz es observar que sus clientes degustan con mucho placer los postres que vende y cuando le vuelven a comprar sabe que está haciendo un buen trabajo. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está agradecida por recibir el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con sus planes, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado comprará los ingredientes necesarios para continuar preparando postres como esencia de frutas, gelatina, envases descartables como vasos y cucharas, bolsas plásticas, azúcar y otros.
texts.en:
Luzdina is 40 years old, and divorced from the father of her four children, ages 22, 20, 16, 1and 14.  All live comfortably in her house.  The city of Pucallpa has a warm climate and its residents are known for their constant search for refreshing desserts.  This is the reason that Luzdina prepares gelatin and frozen treats daily.  She has a refrigerator in her home, where she freezes the products she makes and her customers arrive to buy delicious desserts.  She’s been doing this for five years and this has helped her to perfect the perfect flavors that her desserts are known for.  She always works alone, since her work doesn’t require much effort, but she sometimes needs help from her daughters.  What makes her happiest is seeing her customers enjoy the desserts she sells and when they return she knows that she is doing a good job.  She is asking for a loan of S/ 1,000 and she is grateful for the financial support that she needs to move forward with her plans.  She also promises to make her payments on time.

She will use the money to buy fruit, gelatin, disposable utensils such as cups, spoons, plastic bags, sugar, and other things.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Margarita Del Carmen

texts.es:
Margarita de 43 años de edad, es una persona casada, tiene dos hijos  entre las edades de 10 a 15 años; ella estudio hasta noveno grado. se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a sus hijos y su esposo a quienes enviá a la escuela mientras ella se dedica actividades  comerciales y su esposo actividades agrícolas.

 Ella comercializa frutas de temporada como aguacate, jocotes, flor de izote  etc. oficio que aprendió de su madre la cuales compra en los alrededores de su residencia y luego va a vender al mercado y además se dedica a vender leche ya que tiene tres vacas que le producen

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar una vaca, que le vende un familiar lo que le ayudara a producir más leche y con la venta  generara suficientes ingresos para el sustento de su familia 

Ella,  desea en un futuro adquirir un vehículo para transportar con más facilidad los productos que vende en el mercado y para realizar viajes a otros lugares y comprar más productos para el negocio.
texts.en:
Margarita is 43 years old, married, and has two children, ages 10 and 15.  She has a ninth grade education.  She rises at 5:00 am, along with her children, whom she sends to school while she works as a merchant and her husband as s farmer.

She sells seasonal fruits such as avocado, jocote, izote flower, etc.  She learned this from her mother  and buys her products around her home and then sells them in the market.  She also sells milk and has three cows.

She needs this loan to buy a cow from a relative, which will help her produce more milk and the sale of this milk will generate enough income for her to support her family.  In the future she wants to buy a vehicle so she can move the products she sells in the market more easily, and so she can also travel to other places and buy more products for the business.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Maciely

texts.es: Maciely, de 25 años está casada con René y junto a él tiene 02 hijos de 01 y 06 años de edad respectivamente, con quienes vive en su casa propia. Maciely se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles en general, pone a la venta arroz, azúcar, pan, leche , huevos, accesorios del hogar, bebidas, embutidos entre otros. Su tienda está instalada en la parte delantera de su hogar ubicada en una zona estratégica de su zona. Lleva ya 02 años con está actividad, cuenta con la ayuda incondicional de su esposo y se siente feliz de poder compartir un negocio que los beneficia a todos. Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite disponer de su tiempo para realizar otras actividades del hogar, este negocio le genera buenas ganancias ya que siempre hay clientes interesados en su productos y vende al por mayor a los minoristas que también tiene como clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos comestibles tales como arroz, pan, huevos, leche, azúcar, aceite y otros productos que le permitan seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Maciely is 25 years old, married to Rene, and has 2 children, ages 1 and 6.  They all live together.  Maciely sells food products such as rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, household accessories, drinks, sausages, and other things.  Her store is located in the front of her house, located in a strategic area in her zone.  She has been doing this for 2 years and her husband’s unconditional help.  He is happy to be able to share in a business that benefits all.  She likes her work because it allows her to have time for other things.  This business generates good earnings and there are always customers interested in her products, which she sells to large and small buyers.  She is asking for this loan of S/ 1,500 and is grateful to those who make this loan possible and she promises to pay on time.  She will use the money to buy products such as rice, bread, eggs, milk, sugar, cooking oil, and other things that will allow her to continue working.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Viktorya

texts.en:
Viktorya lives in Marmashen village with her three grown children and her grandparents, who are retired with a pension. As a skilled farmer with many years of experience in that field, Viktorya runs her farm with great love and care. She keeps cows and chickens and cultivates barley and potato. 

Because of financial difficulties, Viktorya isn't able to cover costs of watering or transporting the harvest to the market. Thus, she has requested this loan of 3000 USD through SEF International to cover those costs. Viktorya also will purchase feed for the livestock. She hopes that lenders will support her farming business and that she will be able to make her farm big and profitable one day.

loans.use: to pay for feed, and to cover watering and transportation costs.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena, vive con su esposo, sus hijos están casados y viven aparte. Ella, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, es una persona reconocida en la zona por su actividad. 
El préstamo que requiere le servirá para comprar la materia prima, tales como: maíz, leña, gas, cal, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a adquirir la mercadería por cantidades mayores y esto le permitirá tener almacenada por varios meses.
 Su sueño es continuar aumentando su clientela e incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
Magdalena lives alone with her husband. Her children are married and live with their families. She makes and sells tortillas. She is known in her area for her work.

The loan she is requesting is to purchase raw materials such as corn, firewood, gas, lime etc… This investment will help her buy merchandise in large quantities at wholesale and this will allow her to stock up for several months.

Her dream is to continue increasing her clientele and sales.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, gas, lime etc…

loans.name: Sabougnouma 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  NAGNASSONI, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le sorgho  avec  Adiarra debout en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et les intrants  pour entretenir  1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 90.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group "SABOUGNOUMA I" are married women, who average 33 years of age and five children each, all living in polygamous families in NAGNASSONI, a village in SIKASSO, the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third farm loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is sorghum, as is the case with Adiarra, who is standing second from the left in the photo. With her loan, she intends to purchase seeds and farm inputs to maintain 1.5 hectares. After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women in the village in SIKASSO.

She plans on making a profit of 90,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband to cover day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr: Afin d’ouvrir des stocks de pagnes et assurer au mieux aux besoins de la famille, Akoélé fait un premier crédit pour atteindre ses  objectifs. Elle a démarré son activité de pagnes à domicile en 2008 et s’approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé. Elle est mariée à un revendeur et maman d’01 enfant de 02ans.
texts.en: To establish stocks of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and to ensure family needs are met, Akoélé is taking out an initial loan to achieve her goals. She started her 'pagne' cloth business in her home in 2008. She gets her supplies from the Grand Marché in Lomé. She is married to a retailer and is a mom of a 2-year-old child.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth and charcoal to sell bois

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 40 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Wilma works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 18 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, coffee, bread, cooking oil, noodles, etc. She has requested a loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sirvard

texts.en:
Sirvard is from Sariar village where she lives with her mother-in-law; her husband is now works abroad and tries to support his family financially from afar. 

Sirvard has been engaged in the farming business for many years. Agriculture is the main source of her income. Sirvar's farm currently consists of cows, sheep, pigs, and chickens, and she also owns a plot of land where wheat, barley, and potato are cultivated. 

Now this hardworking woman has asked for a loan for renovating her old greenhouse. She also plans to cover watering and transportation costs with the loan's help. Sirvard hopes for lenders' support as the loan will greatly ease her problems and she will be able to continue running her farm.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the barn and cover watering and transportation costs

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram lives with his wife in the town of Kapan in the Syunik region of Armenia. He earns his living by providing vehicle-repair services. He is very skilled and has gained many loyal customers. Now, in order to increase his working capital, Aram is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD. The loan will help him to purchase equipment for his car repair business and provide better service to his clients.

Aram waits for lenders' support. The loan is very important for him, as the business he runs is the only source of income for Aram and his wife.

loans.use: to pay for equipment for his car repair business.

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José es un joven de 21 años, esta acompañado y tiene 2 hijos, por problemas de la pobreza en que vivian sus padres, solo estudio octavo grado, ya que era necesario que ayudara en las labores agrícolas y cuido de los animales. Actualmente, tiene 6 novillos y se dedica a la siembra de maíz, todos los días a las 6:00 de la mañana, lleva los animales al potrero, y después trabaja en labores de mantenimiento de su milpa, es así como logra conseguir los ingresos para el sustento diario de sus hijos.         

 Para adquirir sus novillos viaja en camión, durante 45 minutos hasta el tiangue, ahí se pasa casi medio día hasta encontrar los novillos que le gustan, después de realizar la compra sube los animales al camión y regresa a casa.   

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 3 novillos de engorde en repasto. De esta manera, incrementara su hato y realizar ventas mas continuas, brindando a su familia una mejor alimentación y educación a sus hijos, ya que los ingresos estarán seguros.

Su sueño es construir una  casa de ladrillo, ya que donde vive es de adobe.
texts.en:
José is 21 years old and has a partner and two children.  Due to how poor his parents were, José was only able to study up to eighth grade as he had to help look after animals and with other agricultural activities.  José currently has six heifers and also makes a living growing corn.  Every day he takes the animals to pasture at six in the morning.  After this, he works to maintain the maize fields and this is how he earns a living to support his children.

In order to buy the heifers, José has a forty-five minute journey to the market and, there, he spends almost a half day looking for the the animals that he likes.  After making his purchases, he takes the animals back to his home in the truck.

José is applying for a loan in order to buy three heifers to fatten up.  With this, he will be able to increase the size of his herd and make constant sales.  As his income will be more secure, José will be able to provide his family with better food and a better education for his family.

José's dream is to build a brick house, as he is currently living in one made of adobe.

loans.use: to buy three heifers for fattening up.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 21ans, Ayoko pour subvenir à ses besoins revend des mèches, des habits dans sa boutique. Son premier crédit lui permettra de stocker plus de marchandises afin de mieux servir ses clients. Elle espère agrandir l’activité et se marier plus tard. Elle a une ancienneté de 02ans.
texts.en: A young woman, Ayoko is 21 years old, and to support herself, she sells hair extensions and clothing in her store. Her first loan will enable her to stock up on more merchandise in order to serve her customers better. She hopes to expand her business and to get married later on. She has two years of seniority.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions, jewelry, and clothing to sell in her store

loans.name: Dovi

texts.fr: Veuve de 55ans, ayant en charge 05 enfants dont 01 scolarisé, Dovi se bat pour apporter du bonheur à ses enfants en vendant du charbon, du mais et ignames à son domicile. Il désire renforcer son activité en gardant ses clients c’est pour cela, elle sollicite un premier prêt à WAGES. Son souhait est d’assurer l’avenir de ses enfants et garder son activité durable.
texts.en: A widow, Dovi is 55 years old and has five children, of whom one is in school. Dovi struggles to bring happiness to her children by selling charcoal, corn, and yams out of her home. She would like to bolster her business by keeping her customers. For this reason, she is requesting an initial loan from WAGES. Her wish is to ensure her children's future and to keep her business sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, yams, and corn to sell

loans.name: Komivi

texts.fr: Célibataire de 31ans, Komivi revend des pièces détachées. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, il sollicite un prêt à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Il s’approvisionne au Nigeria et à Lomé. Il espère avec le profit agrandir son activité et ouvrir un cyber. Komivi a une ancienneté de 08ans.
texts.en: Unmarried and 31 years old, Komivi sells replacement parts. To respond better to the needs of his customer, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase some merchandise. He gets his supplies from Nigeria and in Lomé. With the profits, he hopes to expand his business and open an internet café. Komivi has eight years of seniority.

loans.use: to purchase replacement parts to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 39 years old and married with two children.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like can goods, milk, sugar, soap, chips, etc.

Alma has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear and cosmetics products.

Alma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like can goods, milk, sugar, soap, chips, etc.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 55 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Corazon has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling bananas and raising livestock.

Corazon aspires to saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, four of whom are in school, Edelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business as a mobile fish vendor in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Edelyn is borrowing 30,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional fish like tulingan, galunggong, lapu-lapu, milk fish, etc. to sell as part of her mobile fish-vending business.

Edelyn has been sustaining her business activities through 21 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish like tulingan, galunggong, and lapu-lapu to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years, and also earns income from raising pigs. She is borrowing 30,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell through her vending business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Elcita

texts.en:
Elcita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now. Elcita has requested a loan of 22,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional fish to process into dried fish to sell.

In the future, Elcita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to process into dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 50 years old and married with three children.

Lucita works hard to provide for her family. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for ten years and also earns an income from direct selling of avon and natasha products. She has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan, and is currently requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, orange juice, soft drinks, soap, groceries, etc. to sell. 

Lucita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, orange juice, soft drinks, soap, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo works hard to support her family. She is married and has a beauty salon business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 35 years now. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

Amparo has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is 43 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Anabella works very hard to provide for them.

Anabella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil, sugar, laundry soap, etc. to sell in her general store.

Anabella has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil, sugar, laundry soap, etc. 

In the future Anabella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Cheril

texts.en:
Cheril is 38 years old and married with four children; three children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cheril has a vegetables and spices vending business in the Philippines. Cheril requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables and spices to sell.

Cheril has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Cheril would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 53 years old and married with one child.

Flora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell like snack foods, biscuits, candies, soft-drinks, noodles, etc. in her general store.

Flora has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Flora aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Kerstine

texts.en:
Kerstine is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Kerstine is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Kerstine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lidia Lissette

texts.es:
Lidia, le surge la necesidad de optar por un nuevo crédito para continuar trabajando en su negocio de venta de comida; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar los productos necesarios, tales como: carnes, pollo, pescado, verduras, condimentos, bebidas, conchas, entre otros.
Cuenta la Sra. Lidia que el préstamo anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y con ello se han obtenido mayores ingresos. Las circunstancias familiares se mantienen, mientras que las condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en:
Lidia is in need of a new loan to continue with her business of selling food. This investment will help her purchase necessary products such as beef, chicken, fish, vegetables, condiments, drinks, conch etc…

Lidia says that the previous loan helped her to increase her inventory and with it she was able to obtain higher revenue. Her family situation remains the same while her economic one has improved.

loans.use: to purchase beef, chicken, fish, vegetables, condiments, drinks, conch etc…

loans.name: Estrella De San Gabriel Group

texts.en:
The women of the Estrella de San Gabriel are entering the second nine month cycle of Namaste business advice, financial education and a small loan.  They all did very well in the first nine month cycle.
